Diagnosis
	1. Right breast cancer - clear cell variant
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	Commenced TCHP protocol 01 Feb 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Grade 3 diarrhea, Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy

	Summary of consultation
	I was very pleased to review [redacted name] today who has been managing remarkably well with her treatment journey despite some significant challenges. She has completed 4 cycles of TCHP (Docetaxel, Carboplatin, Trastuzumab, Pertuzumab) chemotherapy for her HER2-positive breast cancer. While she has shown tremendous resilience throughout, she has unfortunately developed quite severe diarrhea (Grade 3) over the past week, requiring temporary hospital admission for IV fluids. She has also noticed increasing tingling and numbness in her fingers and toes (Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy).

On examination today, she appears somewhat dehydrated but maintaining oral intake. There is no evidence of local recurrence in the right breast. The surgical site has healed well. Her performance status remains 1 despite these toxicities.

Given these significant side effects, and after careful discussion with [redacted name] and the breast MDT, we have agreed to modify her treatment plan. We will discontinue the Docetaxel and Carboplatin components but continue with the targeted therapies (Trastuzumab and Pertuzumab) to complete her planned 6 cycles.

	Further investigations
	ECHO arranged for 25 April 2024

	Medication prescribed
	Loperamide for diarrhea management

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks with ECHO results

	Required GP actions
	Weekly monitoring of U&Es until diarrhea resolves

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Discussed treatment modification plan and management of current side effects. Written information provided regarding peripheral neuropathy management.
